description: gaum +‎ -y, from gaum (“to smear”), which see for more.

adjectives.description: gaumy (comparative more gaumy, superlative most gaumy)

entries.meaning: (US and UK, dialects) Sticky; smeared with something sticky.
examples: But the Swami went just as the Swami,
After oiling the kinks in his hair.
I said to Hermione: "Goddess! You're graceful, you're Greek, you're a rose,  […] "
